p: This review exposes the multi-dimensional outcomes due to emergence and spread of AMR of malaria, tuberculosis and HIV to the antimicrobials recommended and/or used for treatment of certain infections. Owing to the increased burden of these infectious diseases in developing countries, most of the studies were conducted in these countries, particularly on clinical outcomes due to AMR. of the three diseases included in this review, tuberculosis’s outcomes due to AMR are mostly recognized by researchers to conduct studies accordingly, which is probably because tuberculosis has a relatively high mortality—the leading cause of death from a single infectious agent (above HIV/AIDS) and AMR rate [ 4].
